snippet: A Dodgers broadcaster since 1950, Vin Scully, 84, returned last month from an early-season illness, to the relief of those who appreciate his melodic play-by-play.
abstract: Vin Scully, Los Angeles Dodgers broadcaster since 1950, returns to the booth after missing five games with severe cold; fans pondered whether the health scare was going to prompt his retirement. (M)
lead_paragraph: Vin Scully's memories of sales of the Dodgers date to 1950, when the team was still in Brooklyn, and now include the recently completed $2.15 billion acquisition by a group that includes Magic Johnson. Scully had just finished his first season as a Dodgers announcer 62 years ago when Walter O'Malley consolidated his power within the franchise and Branch Rickey, the team president and part-owner, was out.

headline.main: Keeping Scully in the Booth Is the Dodgers' Easiest Call
